title: What are some of the best Korean horror movies? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm a big fan of the Thriller genre and have watched some korean thrillers.I will list them out: Memories of Murder  South Korea in 1986 under the military dictatorship: Two rural cops and a special detective from the capital investigate a series of brutal rape murder. Their crude measures become more desperate with each new corpse found. Based on a true case.  The chaser  A cash-strapped pimp and former police detective draws upon the skills of his old job to track down his missing stable of prostitutes.  Oldboy  After being kidnapped and imprisoned for 15 years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must find his captor in 5 days.  New World Story about a conflict between the police and the mob through the eyes of an undercover cop.  A tale of two sisters A family is haunted by the tragedies of deaths within the family.  The man from Nowhere A quiet pawnshop keeper with a violent past takes on a drug- and organ trafficking ring in hope of saving the child who is his only friend.  I saw the devil  A secret agent exacts revenge on a serial killer through a series of captures and releases.

-Park Chan-wook's “Vengeance Trilogy” :  Sympathy for Mr. Vengeance (2002)  Oldboy (2003)  Sympathy for Lady Vengeance (2005)  I agree with Saurabh Misra, don't read the plot before watching the movies) Also strongly recommended I Saw the Devil (2010)  Bedevilled (2010)  A Tale of Two Sisters (2003)  Memories of Murder (2003)  A Bittersweet Life (2005)  Confession of Murder (2012)  Monster (2014)  The Chaser (2008)  The Man from Nowhere (2010)  -

What kind of horror do you like? R-Point is a nice little ghost story that takes place during the Vietnam War. Arang is a well done movie, too. I Saw the Devil is a masterpiece, it is a cross between horror and crime drama and you might feel a bit depressed after watching it. But it is an amazing movie. The Host is a monster movie that everyone either loves or hates. A lot of people do love it. And of course, A Tale of Two Sisters is wonderful.

The Wailing Tale of Two Sisters Bedeviled The Host Thirst There's some I really enjoy covering a broad smattering of horror subgenres. I would recommend going into Tale of Two Sisters and Bedeviled cold. The other three are demonic possession, kaiju (monster) and vampire movies, respectively. This has caused me to realize I'm behind on my K-horror viewing, there are several from the last few years I need to see yet.
